text: I often set the DocumentRoot of a vhost to a file (PHP script) to remap requests for all URIs to a single point of entry.  This works just fine and has never given me a problem, but Apache throws a warning about the DocumentRoot not existing.  The existence check should probably just check for existence, and not that the DocumentRoot is a directory (which is what it is apparently doing now) or at least give a more accurate warning ("DocumentRoot is not a directory") or something.
